Here is my take as an R&D engineer and hobby investor. WD has been a great company but waiting for the data revolution provided by the current big data approach to AI that is forever hungry for more data, and that enables apps and business models that are data-centric which produce and consume even more data. But just like the CD ROM that had its day, SSD now has a lower cost of ownership than HDD when you consider (a) its tiny power use and even tinier resting parasitic consumption and (b) its much smaller size. And that is forgetting that it is the tortoise and the hare comparison for speed needed by AI and any cloud app. One more generation of shrink and the cost of SSD per bit will be the same. So, HDD will be retired. Given that, WD only has its NAND side. This would be the real reason for splitting the company i.e. a clear view through the crystal ball. Same happened to vacuum tube monitors/TVs around 2008. Mechanical stuff will always be replaced by solid state if that is possible. It is happening now accelerated by AI. And that is why, after a lot of thinking this thru, I have stopped investing in WD as it really is a value trap that will then devalue after perhaps a short term pop. But the reason it has been going down is that the institutions see clearly that HDD will be retired soon and it is going to be hard to support WD's value if you write that side of the business off. But if you split it then writing off is an easier exercise.

Has to be the most undervalued value AI stock in history. Massively profitable and massive growth to come. Huge patent porfolio, both HDD and flash, and now eSSD specifically adapted to enterprise market. Forward guaranteed PE of about 7 because the order book is full for over a year. No earnings surprises to come except higher margins and more sales. No massive build out of capital rich manufacturing capacity as they already did that. And most stocks are on 20 to 40 forward PE if a risk plan pans out. So, complete technical and execution safety, no risk, guaranteed earnings and low PE, and massive AI growth as data storage requirements go exponential. And why would they even think to split the business when flash+HDD is a required combo for performance versus capacity? Only -ve is sentiment in a pre-AI era of cyclical PC markets which this is not. Wow.

What in the world does this company have to do to make a real move above levels it achieved over a decade ago while other tech is up hundreds or thousands of percent since then? Seagate Technology (STX) is collaborating with its cloud partners to secure qualifications for its products in the cloud segment, Chief Financial Officer Gianluca Romano said at a technology conference Wednesday.The process is taking longer than expected due to the rigorous demands placed on the products, especially in core environments. But, the company has the ball rolling and is making good progress every week, Romano said, according to a Capital IQ transcript.The qualification process for the cloud segment may extend into the next quarter, but the company has made significant advancements in the on-premise data center, a crucial market segment where artificial intelligence-driven demand is expected to increase the consumption in the coming quarters.The company is confident in its heat-assisted magnetic recording, or HAMR, product despite delays and has begun working with multiple cloud customers in the US and China, expecting the full qualification process in around three quarters, with a ramp-up in volume expected by mid-2025, the executive said.HAMR's impact on profitability will remain limited until mid-2025

Separation - make of this transcript what you want.  It's not mine - so don't blame me for the gibberish.  But you can get the gist of it"We think these are better separate assets, especially around that they're executing extremely long. And so I think we started down our process. We announced it October 30 of last year. It's on a very big base inside the company with Super companies got 50,000-plus itâ€™s -- it's 2 big franchises, we mean gibbon our path and we expect to getting to the plants month early October and we've got all of our IT systems separated. We've got our self-organized and where we can start operating 2 separate companies and make sure we can process orders, make sure we collect on in a road on an attributable to 2 separate businesses. It's called the soft spin in the parlance of people that do spins all the time. And we'll execute in that mode for the next quarter through the December quarter. And then when we get through that, we get conviction, we can close the books on 2 independent public companies. We'll do that most likely through the December quarter and then we'll go through the separation process. So a very long process."It's already been a long process (really 3+ years) and still going longer.

Looks to me like it is time for this stock to shine and grow rather than follow earlier pre-AI era cyclical sales.

Ok, guys. I Just went through the numbers, and the earnings are actually a lot better than it looks. I wonâ€™t be surprised if the stock closes in the green tomorrow :) Hereâ€™s what the after-hours sellers are missingâ€¦.

TL;DR EPS guidance was solid, WDC HDD is hitting it out of the park and net debt is likely to go down significantly.

1) EPS guidance is actually a lot better than it looks

Guide for EPS $1.70 midpoint (vs $1.73 consensus) looks like a miss but it includes three non-operating items that are not in consensus numbers:

a) $15-25M in separation costs

b) 15-17% tax rate vs 8% expected

c) Higher share count 360M vs 349M

These non-operating costs add up to a $0.25 hit to the EPS guide i.e. the apples-to-apples guide is $0.22 above consensus. And likely conservative given the past pattern of crushing their own guidanceâ€¦
